      • getString

        public static java.lang.String getString(java.lang.String inputMsg,
                                         java.lang.String errorMsg,
                                         java.lang.String regex)
        Prompts the user for a string input, validates it using a regular expression, and returns the entered value.
        Parameters:
        inputMsg - The message to display as a prompt for the user.
        errorMsg - The error message to display if the entered string does not match the specified regex pattern.
        regex - The regular expression pattern to validate the entered string.
        Returns:
        The validated string value entered by the user.

      • getString

        public static java.lang.String getString(java.lang.String inputMsg,
                                         int min,
                                         int max)
        Prompts the user for a string input and validates its length to be within the specified range, then returns the entered value.
        Parameters:
        inputMsg - The message to display as a prompt for the user.
        min - The minimum allowed length for the entered string.
        max - The maximum allowed length for the entered string.
        Returns:
        The validated string value entered by the user.

      • getDate

        public static java.lang.String getDate(java.lang.String inputMsg,
                                       java.lang.String dateFormat)
        Prompts the user for a date input and validates it against the specified date format, then returns the entered value.
        Parameters:
        inputMsg - The message to display as a prompt for the user.
        dateFormat - The format string representing the expected date format.
        Returns:
        The validated date string entered by the user.

      • getYesOrNo

        public static boolean getYesOrNo(java.lang.String msg)
        Displays a menu with "Yes" and "No" options and prompts the user to choose one. Returns true if the user chooses "Yes", and false if the user chooses "No".
        Parameters:
        msg - The message to display as a prompt for the user.
        Returns:
        true if the user chooses "Yes", false if the user chooses "No".
